flags.quote: There's a concept in Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu analysis called studying "off the move." When reviewing footage, elite coaches don't focus on the submission itself. The same principle applies to social interactions. The moment she walked away isn't where you lost her. That's just when it became visible. The actual pivot point happened earlier — maybe thirty seconds, maybe three minutes before. Something shifted. The energy changed. You missed a signal or sent the wrong one. That's your 20%.
